forecast.name: Tonight
forecast.detailedForecast: Areas of drizzle after 8pm. Mostly cloudy, with a low around 45. South southwest wind around 10 mph, with gusts as high as 20 mph. Chance of precipitation is 30%. New rainfall amounts less than a tenth of an inch possible.

weather_report:
The current weather in Evanston paints a vivid picture of a brisk December afternoon. With temperatures hovering in the low 50s, the atmosphere feels refreshingly cool, complemented by a steady, gusty breeze that lends a slightly invigorating chill to the air. Visibility is clear, ideal for gazing upon the tranquil waters of Lake Michigan. As we look ahead, the forecast indicates that conditions will remain sunny through the day, but temperatures are expected to drop slightly to the upper 40s. Tonight, we can expect increasing cloudiness along with areas of drizzle developing after 8 PM, introducing a 30% chance of light precipitation as the temperature settles around the mid-40s.

Given this blend of factors, the beach scene is likely to be less crowded and more inviting for a brisk stroll or some peaceful reflection by the shore. Wave activity is expected to remain moderate, making it a serene spot for quiet contemplation, though perhaps not ideal for any vigorous water sports. Attire-wise, layering will be essential to ensure comfort against the chillier breezes, with perhaps a light waterproof jacket as evening approaches. This weather is typical for this time of year in this region, reminding us all that winter is indeed settling in. As the sun sets on this December day, take advantage of the fresh outdoor air before the expected drizzle invites one indoors.
